N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 300-1.5 - Authority

State Regulations
(a) In addition to
its other statutory authorities, the State Police is hereby authorized to take
such action as may reasonably be necessary to maintain order, safety, and
security on State property. (b) Designated representatives of the office or the State Police, such as, but not
limited to security guards, shall have the authority to prevent trespass, theft
or damage, and to maintain order on State property. Notes
